trigger_prototype.name: SMART state of {#SNMPVALUE} on {HOST.NAME} is ABNORMAL
trigger_prototype.description: Abnormal 1. Any SMART value is equal or less than trhreshold. 2. Hard Disk temperature is higher than 65 degree C. -------- QNAP Knowledgebase

trigger_prototype.name: SMART state of {#SNMPVALUE} on {HOST.NAME} is not GOOD ({ITEM.VALUE1})
trigger_prototype.description: Normal 1. Any Smart value is equal or less than threhold + (initial_SMART_value - threhold)/2. For example, if the initial SMART value is 100, the current value is 50, the threshold is 20, then the Smart value, 50, is less than 20+(100-20)/2. Thus, the health level would be Normal. 2. Any SMART test(Rapid or Complete) result of last 20 times is abnormal. 3. Hard Disk temperature is between 55 to 65 degree C. -------- QNAP Knowledgebase

trigger_prototype.name: Temperature of {#SNMPVALUE} on {HOST.NAME} is over {$HD_TEMPERATURE_ALARM} for 2 min
Temperature of {#SNMPVALUE} on {HOST.NAME} is over {$HD_TEMPERATURE_WARNING} for 2min
Free space is less than 20% on volume {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger.name: CPU utilization on {HOST.NAME} is over 80% for 15 min
CPU utilization on {HOST.NAME} is over 95% for 15 min
